channel.title: Anyone going Hunting?
channel.description: Well, as we all know, Or at least me. GUN SEASON STARTS SATURDAY (Oct. 18) and muzzle loader started the saturday before that (but I dont own a muzzle loader). Yep... Me and my dad and our neighbor are going white tail deer hunting.. and I have a feeling this is gonna be my year to get something (Never shot one yet)... So, Does anyone else hunt..? Or any good hunting storys?

item.title: Anyone going Hunting?

GUN SEASON STARTS SATURDAY (Oct. 18)

This simply means more inactivity from mopar.

He’s the hunting expert around here.
[/quote]Rednecks[me=Pwnd]sighs.[/me]


RESEMBLANCE?[/quote]
lmfao nice.

Good job mopar.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone going Hunting?
item.dc:creator: @srt8 srt8
item.description:
@srt8 wrote:

jme:

Thats horrible I actually feel bad for it. I don’t mind hunters but at least make it an instant kill…

I agree! I guess if you want to hunt, it’s okay…i personally don’t believe in it…but some people were raised with hunting and use the meat, which is fine, but i don’t know. I can’t imagine killing an innocent deer. The only way i could possibly kill an animal is if i was being attacked or something, and i know i would still be sad afterward. I know, i’m weird.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone going Hunting?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

jme:

Thats horrible I actually feel bad for it. I don’t mind hunters but at least make it an instant kill…

Well of course you try to make an instant kill. Do you think I enjoyed crawling through thorn bushes tracking drops of blood in the dark for 3 hours? I actually hit him where I was aiming, in the heart/lung region, but he was turned at an angle, so it went in there, nipped a lung and came out through his stomach on the other side.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone going Hunting?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:29, topic:237004”]Well I killed a 7 point buck Friday, shot him with my bow from about 10 yards out of my treestand. I shot him about 6:30pm right before it went dark, and the arrow went all the way through. It was dark when my dad and I finally got flashlights and started tracking him. We tracked him through really thick brush following tiny drops of blood every few feet, about 10pm after crossing a road we found him lying on the ground and he jumped up and ran away from us for about 20 yards. By this time it was well into the night, too late to legally have a bow in the woods. I snuck up on him hoping I could cut it’s throat, but when I tapped it’s head with my foot it got up and charged me, then ran away for a little longer. My dad found a long, sturdy stick and I used my shoe lace to tie my hunting knife onto the end of the stick, making it into a spear. I snuck up on the deer who was laying down again and speared it in the heart, twisting the spear and pulling it out. The deer died almost immediately.

I’ve never killed a deer with a spear before.

For those interested, here is a pic of it:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/images/buck0809.jpg[/quote]

Nice kill, altough your smile seems faked

I’d love to go hunting someday, but here in the Netherlands it’s almost impossible. There aren’t a lot of forests that are big enough, and your not allowed to hunt in the forests that are protected.

Read full topic

@Payback_Is_A_Bitch wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:29, topic:237004”]Well I killed a 7 point buck Friday, shot him with my bow from about 10 yards out of my treestand. I shot him about 6:30pm right before it went dark, and the arrow went all the way through. It was dark when my dad and I finally got flashlights and started tracking him. We tracked him through really thick brush following tiny drops of blood every few feet, about 10pm after crossing a road we found him lying on the ground and he jumped up and ran away from us for about 20 yards. By this time it was well into the night, too late to legally have a bow in the woods. I snuck up on him hoping I could cut it’s throat, but when I tapped it’s head with my foot it got up and charged me, then ran away for a little longer. My dad found a long, sturdy stick and I used my shoe lace to tie my hunting knife onto the end of the stick, making it into a spear. I snuck up on the deer who was laying down again and speared it in the heart, twisting the spear and pulling it out. The deer died almost immediately.

I’ve never killed a deer with a spear before.

For those interested, here is a pic of it:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/images/buck0809.jpg[/quote]
Nice me and my friend wes went hunting this weekend I didn’t get jack but he got a 12 point and a spike… I was kinda pissed…

item.title: Anyone going Hunting?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Well I killed a 7 point buck Friday, shot him with my bow from about 10 yards out of my treestand. I shot him about 6:30pm right before it went dark, and the arrow went all the way through. It was dark when my dad and I finally got flashlights and started tracking him. We tracked him through really thick brush following tiny drops of blood every few feet, about 10pm after crossing a road we found him lying on the ground and he jumped up and ran away from us for about 20 yards. By this time it was well into the night, too late to legally have a bow in the woods. I snuck up on him hoping I could cut it’s throat, but when I tapped it’s head with my foot it got up and charged me, then ran away for a little longer. My dad found a long, sturdy stick and I used my shoe lace to tie my hunting knife onto the end of the stick, making it into a spear. I snuck up on the deer who was laying down again and speared it in the heart, twisting the spear and pulling it out. The deer died almost immediately.

I’ve never killed a deer with a spear before.

For those interested, here is a pic of it:

Good luck though.
